# Contributing to the DATA 100 Course Website

Thank you for your interest in contributing to the DATA C100 course website.
Your help improves the learning experience for everyone and becomes part of the
living history of Data 100 at UC Berkeley.

## How to Contribute

You can propose changes to the course website by:

1. **Forking** this repository  
   See GitHub’s guide on forking:  
   https://help.github.com/articles/fork-a-repo/

2. **Making your edits** in your fork  
   Examples of useful contributions include:
   - Fixing typos or broken links  
   - Improving explanations or formatting  
   - Updating outdated information  
   - Adding helpful resources for students

3. **Submitting a Pull Request**  
   Learn more about pull requests here:  
   https://help.github.com/articles/about-pull-requests/

   Please include:
   - A clear description of what you changed  
   - The motivation for the change  
   - Any relevant context or screenshots

Once your pull request is reviewed and merged, you will become part of the history of Data 100 at Berkeley！

## Contribution Guidelines

To keep the course website consistent and maintainable:

- Keep changes **focused and minimal**  
- Follow the existing **style and structure** of the site  
- Write clear, concise, and student-friendly language  
- Ensure all links and references are valid  
- Test locally if your change affects rendering or navigation

## Questions

If you are unsure whether a change is appropriate, feel free to open an issue to discuss your idea before submitting a pull request.

We appreciate your contributions and your role in supporting the DATA 100 learning community.
